channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shopping trolley full of bags of rubbish. Victoria Road Erith., 19th September
item.description:
Yet again someone has left a shopping trolley full of bags of rubbish and also bags of rubbish on the pavement outside Christchurch in Victoria Road, Erith. Appreciate if this can be removed as soon as possible before the foxes rip the bags apart. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the highway near 83 Dyne Road, 19th September
item.description:
Previous two cases were closed but bricks have not been removed. Inadequate response by the Council. Public highway is being obstructed and bricks need to be removed please because they have been left there for over 3 months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Dog fouling in green, 19th September
item.description:
Green is filled with dog poo. Smells and is a health hazard for kids. Owners daily allow pets to foul without cleaning up after. Please impose £100 fines, warning signs and patrols. It’s not fair on residents. Problem Has been worsening for months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1c, Pleydell Avenue, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chislehurst High Street Recycling Site - All of the recycling bins are overflowing and fly tipping, 19th September
item.description:
Chislehurst High Street Recycling Site - All of the recycling bins are overflowing and fly tipping especially for the clothing and shoe bins, which have not been emptied and there is rubbish and fly tipping all over the floor. Please can you arrange for all of these to be emptied? Many thanks in advance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual Flytipping at this Location, 19th September
item.description:
Once again at the same location Chairs x 3 and wooden pallet have been flytipped. This is a continual problem at this spot which is happening on an almost weekly basis. Please can we have more robust enforcement and a covert camera installed to catch the offender(s) to stop this keep happening. Can arrangements be made to remove all the items ASAP as shown in the photos shown

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 chairs and some wooden pallets dumped on pavement, 19th September
item.description:
The flytipping is an ongoing issue in this area. It costs the council money and also us as council tax payers to keep having it removed . It would make far more sense to install a camera to catch the perpetrators. The council would soon reap the cost of doing this back by implementing the fines that are threatened on the notice right by the flytipping !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: House clearence dumped on street at entrance to Cunningham House, 19th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hopewell Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The protective fence around one of the three conifers is broken and hanging off., 19th September
item.description:
There are three conifers which were planted within the last five years on Bursted Woods field at the position shown. The trees are pushing at the boundaries and the braches are being forced to bend. (Not sure how often these protections are checked?) One of the trees would appear to have had the fencing vandalised. One sideis hanging loosely away from the structure and one side has been completely removed and lays on the ground nearby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
